All Classes

Class Description
AppServerDriver
A websocket connection that has been established.
Configuration
Stores Configuration properties regarding the server.
ConfigurationException
A subclass of RuntimeException to personalize and group specifically errors in the Configuration classes.
ConfigurationManager
Manages the current configuration settings of the server.
Joystick
This is a JSON Object that contains the data regarding the joystick or the player's movement on the x and y scale.
Json
The Json class works with reading and writing Json using an ObjectMapper.
Json
The Json class works with reading and writing Json using an ObjectMapper.
JsonHeader
This is a JSON header used distinguish what kind of message is being sent to and from the server to the client and user.
ServerConnectionWorkerThread
Works with the communication and handling of messages.
ServerListenerThread
A subclass of Thread, using Threads from our server to execute some sort of process with the client connecting to the port the Server is listening to.
Session
The session represents a single client and the connected controllers
Token  
User
The following is a JSON Object containing data regarding the User's information for connecting to the server and the game client.
UserController
The following is a JSON Object used to send data regarding the users controller to the client.
WebServerDriver
Driver class for the webserver.
WebsocketConnection
This class houses threads that the server distributes to each user to have their own dedicated socket to send and receive messages.
WebsocketController
Never ended up using this but it would interpret a message and confirm input was practical and santised
WebSocketGameClient
Currently used used to sanatice and recate to messages from the client
WebsocketManager
Handles the websockets connections and active sessions.
WebsocketMsgReceiver
Overall unused but would allow santisation of messages received from different types of websocket connections
